title: Parmesan Crusted Chicken Recipe
description: This Parmesan-crusted chicken with mayo is the simplest and most savory way to dress up chicken breasts for a tasty supper that's ready in 30 minutes!

Breast Parmesan Crusted Chicken 4.7 (356) 294 Reviews 43 Photos This Parmesan-crusted chicken with mayo is the simplest and most savory way to dress up chicken breasts for a quick supper. Just top them with mayonnaise, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs, and bake. Dinner will be ready in 30 minutes or less! Submitted by Hellmann's Updated on May 17, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 43 43 43 43 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ½ cup Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese 4 (5 ounce) boneless, skinless chicken breast halves 4 teaspoons Italian seasoned dry bread crumbs Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix mayonnaise and Parmesan cheese together in a medium bowl until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange chicken breasts on a baking sheet. Evenly top with mayonnaise mixture, then sprinkle with bread crumbs to coat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until golden on top and chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 540 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 400 Calories 28g Fat 2g Carbs 32g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 400 % Daily Value * Total Fat 28g 36% Saturated Fat 5g 25% Cholesterol 96mg 32% Sodium 374mg 16% Total Carbohydrate 2g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 0% Total Sugars 0g Protein 32g 63% Calcium 73mg 6% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 249mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Parmesan Crusted Chicken 01 of 43 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 43 Photo by  tmmiller26 05/28/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Family favorite Made this with 7 chicken breasts. Doubled the ingredients. Added 1/2 teaspoon of garlic and dijon mustard to the mayo/cheese, and used panko bread crumbs instead of Italian. Baked for 30 minutes instead of 20, and it came out great! Served with cheesy mashed potatoes and garlic green beans. 03 of 43 Photo by  SweetPot1815 01/08/2024 Delicious! I added crushed croutons & panko on top. Then sprinkled a little more Parmesan. The last 3 minutes I turned the oven off. 04 of 43 Photo by  BlueSpoon6922 07/25/2023 Very yummy and so easy. I added an extra teaspoon of a bunch of seasonings to the breadcrumbs and it was so delicious! 05 of 43 Photo by  CaringPrawn2314 07/18/2023 Yes I used cod fish. 06 of 43 Photo by  Janette Schafer 04/11/2021 A family favorite for busy nights. If your family prefers dark meat as mine does, substitute 6 boneless/skinless thighs for the 4 boneless/skinless breasts. That’s what I did tonight. 07 of 43 Photo by  Frances L Hawver 03/09/2021 08 of 43 Photo by  ash 03/05/2020 I really enjoyed this recipe! I hadn’t added the Italian bread crumbs and instead just used Italian seasoning since I’m on keto. I’d also added garlic and onion powder. In the future I’m going to add some dijon mustard and maybe a little bit of paprika and some hotter seasoning. It’s good, it just needs more flavor. 09 of 43 Photo by  ash 03/05/2020 I really enjoyed this recipe! I hadn’t added the Italian bread crumbs and instead just used Italian seasoning since I’m on keto. I’d also added garlic and onion powder. In the future I’m going to add some dijon mustard and maybe a little bit of paprika and some hotter seasoning. It’s good, it just needs more flavor. 10 of 43 Photo by  Fritz W 02/19/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Easy Parmesan-Crusted Chicken 292 Ratings Crunchy Baked Pesto Chicken Thighs 45 Ratings Pesto-Stuffed Chicken Breast 22 Ratings Farm Lady's Delicious Chicken Parmesan 23 Ratings Quick One-Pot Chicken Alfredo 28 Ratings Easy Chicken Saltimbocca 101 Ratings Simply Parmesan Chicken 470 Ratings Easier Chicken Marsala 845 Ratings Bacon Wrapped Pesto Chicken 186 Ratings Keto Chicken Parmesan 165 Ratings Easy One-Pot Chicken Alfredo 5 Ratings Simple Baked Parmesan Chicken 28 Ratings Instant Pot® Chicken Marsala 6 Ratings Creamy Pesto Chicken 37 Ratings Spinach Chicken Parmesan 600 Ratings Pesto-Stuffed Chicken Breasts Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Hellmann's
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix mayonnaise and Parmesan cheese together in a medium bowl until well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Arrange chicken breasts on a baking sheet. Evenly top with mayonnaise mixture, then sprinkle with bread crumbs to coat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until golden on top and chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
